title: System shut down without savefile warning
description: When shutting down the Windows System with a WSWB session open and some opened, dirty .txt file, the changes in the .txt file are lost without any warning or message box to prompt users to save their changes. Other Windows programs like Word or Outlook have this feature.
OB: When shutting down the Windows System with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, the changes in the .txt file are lost without any warning or message box to prompt users to save their changes.
EB: When shutting down the Windows System with a WSWB session open and a dirty .txt file, users should be prompted with a warning or message box, giving them a chance to save their changes before the system is shut down.
SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer

Expected Results:
A warning or message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.

Note: Check if other Windows programs like Word or Outlook exhibit similar behavior.
